# Easy RSA Writeup
chall.txt
```
n = 
e = 3
ciphertext = 250383313861288772579552185112260515620934440209335681248467385170408686167759234233964620256298646467799653788002398355192170597
```

Really interesting mathmatical property about RSA encryption when the public exponent e is 3 you can just take Cube root of the ciphertext and get the decrypted message WOW
i really need to look in to the workings of the Cube Root attack really interesting ngl

```python
import sympy
from Crypto.Util.number import *

e=3 # cube root attack only works when public exponent is low like 3

ciphertext = 250383313861288772579552185112260515620934440209335681248467385170408686167759234233964620256298646467799653788002398355192170597

flag = long_to_bytes(sympy.cbrt(ciphertext)).decode()
print(flag)
```
```
HZU18(IAMNOTCUBE!}
```
